paragraph.htmltext: In the vehicle production the packs are first unpacked. Whenever a pack is handled, the temperature need to be checked regularly to be able to detect a thermal runaway in an early phase.
When unpacked, the pack can be measured to see if it fulfils the requirements and to check on damages.

A built in diagnostics system can verify if the pack is correctly assembled prior to the installation of the pack in the vehicle. The design of the diagnostics shall be done during the design and development of the pack.

After unpacking the pack can be placed on the production line. To avoid electrocution at the line, the connectors of the pack need to be covered and high voltage gloves are needed. The temperature need also be checked when the packs are on the production line.

To avoid leakage, the enclosure of the packs need to be resistant against the mechanical abuse which can cause the leakage.
